title: Test broken because NITRC is down
body:
Example failures from #1468. Opening this issue in order to reenable the tests that I will disable now, when NITRC is back:

````
======================================================================
FAIL: datalad.crawler.pipelines.tests.test_fcptable.test_dataset('Baltimore', None, False, False)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.4.4/lib/python3.4/site-packages/nose/case.py", line 198, in runTest
    self.test(*self.arg)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.4.4/lib/python3.4/site-packages/vcr/cassette.py", line 95, in __call__
    function, args, kwargs
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.4.4/lib/python3.4/site-packages/vcr/cassette.py", line 103, in _execute_function
    return handler(function, args, kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.4.4/lib/python3.4/site-packages/vcr/cassette.py", line 130, in _handle_function
    return self.__handle_function(cassette, function, args, kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.4.4/lib/python3.4/site-packages/vcr/cassette.py", line 126, in __handle_function
    return function(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 790, in newfunc
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 579, in newfunc
    return t(*(arg + (filename,)), **kw)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/crawler/pipelines/tests/test_fcptable.py", line 73, in _test_dataset
    assert_true(exists("README.txt"))
AssertionError: False is not true
````
